ImageData.LabelName: Cancer in: One or both sides and nearby lymph nodes

OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Made the cancer spot match the spot in the Stage IIIC image so that it doesn’t extend outside the prostate

Capitalized the first letter of each word after a colon; added shaded pull-out cone from main figure to pull-out box; put the Stage information first in title; removed the cancer spots from the seminal vesicle and the left side of the prostate, and from where it extends out of the prostate on the right side; and changed the wording in the box to say: “Cancer in: One or both sides and nearby lymph nodes”
Unbolded Cancer label; added labels for Bladder, Rectum, Prostate, Urethra; and changed the word “lobes” to “sides” in inset box
New image per AJCC 8th edition updates

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Stage IVA prostate cancer; drawing shows cancer in one side of the prostate and in nearby lymph nodes. The PSA can be any level and the Grade Group is 1 ,2, 3, 4, or 5. Also shown are the bladder, rectum, and urethra.

Stage IVA prostate cancer; drawing shows cancer in one side of the prostate and in nearby lymph nodes. The PSA can be any level and the Grade Group is 1 ,2, 3, 4, or 5. Also shown are the bladder, rectum, and urethra.

Captions.MediaCaption: Stage IVA prostate cancer. Cancer is found in one or both sides of the prostate and may have spread to the seminal vesicles or to nearby tissue or organs, such as the rectum, bladder, or pelvic wall. Cancer has spread to nearby lymph nodes. The prostate-specific antigen can be any level and the Grade Group is 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5.

Stage IVA prostate cancer. Cancer is found in one or both sides of the prostate and may have spread to the seminal vesicles or to nearby tissue or organs, such as the rectum, bladder, or pelvic wall. Cancer has spread to nearby lymph nodes. The prostate-specific antigen can be any level and the Grade Group is 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5.

ProcessingStatus.ProcessingStatusValue: Approved by expert reviewer with changes
ProcessingStatus.Comment: No additional changes needed per OCC multimedia group
